popText.text: I asked Tom whether he was authorized to receive the list of addresses, and he clearly wasn’t. There was no way I was going to provide him with those reports – and the fact that he offered me money made me wonder whether his intentions were completely honest.

I reported this to my manager, Roger. But I don’t think he believed me. He said I was probably overreacting and that Tom has an active imagination. Roger said he would “take care of it” but I am not convinced.

It was good that Emma came to talk to me, but what she told me doesn’t sound like the Tom I know. He was probably making a joke and Emma took it too seriously. I told her to lighten up, and that I would “take care of it.” Knowing Tom, I doubt he means any harm. I’ll mention it to him when I see him again just to be sure.
